sentence.Network_en: The gentlest of her caresses would contort his already tense body.
sentence.Network_cn: 她最温柔的爱抚会让他已然紧绷的身体变得扭曲。

sentence.Network_en: Some peoples mouths open. Others faces contort.
sentence.Network_cn: 有些人嘴巴张开, 另一些人面部扭曲.

sentence.Network_en: I didn't care how much I had to contort my body and my principles.
sentence.Network_cn: 我毫不顾及自己的身体和原则被怎样扭曲.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin contort- 'twisted round, brandished', from the verb contorquere, from con- 'together' + torquere 'twist'

entry.def: If someone's face or body contorts or is contorted, it moves into an unnatural and unattractive shape or position.

example.ex: His face contorts as he screams out the lyrics...
example.tran: 当他吼出这些歌词的时候，脸都扭曲了。

example.ex: The gentlest of her caresses would contort his already tense body...
example.tran: 她最温柔的爱抚会让他已然紧绷的身体变得扭曲。

means.word_mean: 1. twist and press out of shape

auth_sentence.content: Boggs could only contort his body, seeing the game get out of hand.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Boggs could only contort his body, seeing the game get out of hand.
